sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Hello, this is Euronews Now. Glad you could join us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I'm Anka Ula, and these are your headlines this Wednesday, June the 8th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia is ready to unblock Ukrainian grain shipments, according to Sergei Lavrov, who's in Ankara.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Turkey calls Moscow's demand that the West lift sanctions legitimate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: World leaders meet in Italy today to discuss what's at stake and potential solutions for the global food crisis made worse by the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And it makes up 70% of our planet's surface.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We take a look at the biggest issues facing our oceans today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Could Turkey hold the key to unlocking Ukraine's grain reserves?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: As Russia's foreign minister, Sergei Lavrov, heads to Istanbul, Turkish officials hope an agreement can be reached that will allow millions of tons of grain to be moved out of Ukrainian ports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ankara plans to leverage its close relations with both Kyiv and Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's definitely not a strategic partnership or a strategic alliance as some people especially in the west call it. So instead of that we are talking about a regional partnership that is very close because the two countries need each other in many different issue areas including the Middle East,ria especially turkey neighbors ukraine and russia in the black sea and has agreed to take on a role with an observation mechanism if a deal on ukraine's grain is reached lavrov and his turkish counterpart are also expected to discuss syria ankara needs moscow's approval to maintain its presence in the north of the country where it plans to launch a new offensive against kurdish militants in the north of the country where it plans to launch a new offensive against Kurdish militants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Addressing global food security is the very aim of the online summit that is taking place today that has been organized by Italy's foreign ministry with the support of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: 24 ministers of several countries and other international organizations will be taking part in the event that is co-chaired by Turkey Lebanon and Germany now the purpose of the summit and that's why it has been called by Italy's to assess the impact of the global food crisis in the Mediterranean area where several countries are much more exposed to that crisis the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, according to its deputy director, as reported in the Italian media, is set to propose a global action plan that is worth 9 billion euros to help poorer countries deal with the impact of such crisis. The majority of the wheat, in fact, that is sold in Africa comes from Ukraine and Russia, and wheat prices have already increased there. And the timing could not be worse, given that the U.N. recently warned that around 13 million people are facing hunger as a result of a persistent drought. Now, as we know, diplomatic efforts are currently underway and pressure has been building up for an international agreement on a rescue mission for Ukraine's grain that is very much needed around the world. George Orlandi, Euronews in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Russia is claiming to have seized residential quarters of the key eastern city of Severodonetsk and to have taken control of 97% of one of the two provinces that make up Ukraine's Donbass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: If confirmed, it brings the Kremlin closer to its goal of fully capturing the eastern industrial heartland of coal mines and factories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: President Volodymyr Zelensky says Ukraine is holding on, despite being outnumbered, but that the battle for Donbas has turned into a war of attrition, reminiscent of trench warfare in World War I.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: As images of the latest destruction in Luhansk emerge, Zelensky said in an interview with a UK newspaper that decisive victories will be won on the front line before negotiations can take place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Of course, victory must be on the battlefield, or so to speak, not only victory, but above all, a strong, solid situation on the battlefield, when we can really see our positions, see the appropriate military equipment, our powerful force, which is not inferior to the amount of Russian equipment." But positions in Moscow seem to be hardening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev voiced his hatred towards opponents of Russia, calling them degenerates who want Russia dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov is in Ankara for talks on restarting grain shipments out of Ukrainian ports on the Black Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Turkey has offered to help escort maritime convoys despite the presence of Russian mines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny has had his appeal rejected by a Russian court over a decision to label him an extremist and terrorist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin's main critic took part in the proceedings via a video link on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The 46-year-old argued that the decision to put him on this list was unlawful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I definitely stand behind every word of the appeal. I believe I was put on that register illegally, both procedurally and by definition. And of course, it's the definition that bothers me the most. I don't understand why I was labelled not only an extremist, but a terrorist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: don't understand why I was labelled not only an extremist but a terrorist." Navalny was arrested in January 2021 when he returned from Germany where he'd been recovering from nerve agent poisoning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He was handed a two and a half year sentence for a parole violation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Then in March this year he was sentenced to nine years in prison on fraud and contempt of court charges, which he calls a politically motivated move. No set office hours and free vacation time, plus a relaxed and vibrant working environment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It sounds like every worker's dream, but it's a reality in this marketing agency in Northern Italy. Velvet Media Italia has 150 employees and more than 500 clients, and its work philosophy is based on people rather than on processes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I think creativity stems from an inner well-being.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: When one lives in anxious and stressful conditions, one tends to be less productive, I mean in terms of the quality of the production.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A far cry from Elon Musk's recent remarks, currently the richest man in the world, who talked about the need for his workers to be physically present in the office at all times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We work on targets rather than on working hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Everybody knows they have a certain number of activities to complete in order to best satisfy our clients. Tutti conoscono che hanno un certo numero di attività da completare per migliorare i nostri clienti.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Per noi, l'esatto momento nel quale le persone iniziano a lavorare è solo irrilevante.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Le persone qui non sembrano preoccupare molto.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Arrivano tardi e lasciano presto, o non si riuscono a riuscire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: E, credo o no, sono chiesti di farlo dal loro boss, se non sono asset valubili per la loro compagnia. Non ci sono standard per seguire, come il puntare a 9 e uscire a 6.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

I'd rather be buying, so to speak, people's creativity, their ability to work in a team, eccetera, eccetera.

sentences.sentence: Un uomo è morto e tre altri sono sbagliati, dopo a mudslide partly enveloped a hotel

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.sentence: The landslide knocked down a retaining wall, swept away branches and went right through the back of the building.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A passenger train partially derailed in eastern Iran early on Wednesday, killing at least 17 people and injuring 50 more, according to authorities. The derailment happened some 50 kilometres outside of Tabas. The train carrying roughly 350 passengers reportedly collided with an excavator near the track.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Well, it's time now for a short break, but don't go away because there's much more news, analysis and sport coming up here on Euronews Now. Stay tuned.
